articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's attempts to keep the yuan from falling contributed to last week's chaos in money markets, sources involved say, pointing to the pressure behind the scenes as Beijing tries to guide its economy and markets through a major slowdown.
articles.title: Exclusive: China's clashing priorities behind rare money market distress

articles.author: Blake Brittain
articles.description: Footwear giant Nike (NKE.N) filed federal lawsuits on Monday against rivals New Balance and Skechers (SKX.N), accusing them of infringing patents related to Nike's technology for making upper portions of sneakers.
articles.title: Nike sues New Balance, Skechers for patent infringement over sneaker technology

articles.author: Katie Paul
articles.description: Facebook owner Meta (META.O) is barring political campaigns and advertisers in other regulated industries from using its new generative AI advertising products, a company spokesperson said on Monday, denying access to tools that lawmakers have warned could turbo-charge the spread of election misinformation.
articles.title: Exclusive: Meta bars political advertisers from using generative AI ads tools

articles.author: Yuvraj Malik
articles.description: Bumble founder (BMBL.O) Whitney Wolfe Herd will step down as CEO of the dating apps operator and hand over the role to seasoned executive Lidiane Jones, knocking its shares down 10% to a record on Monday.
articles.title: Bumble shares drop as founder Wolfe Herd to relinquish CEO role

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's real wages slipped in September for an 18th month, government data showed on Tuesday, with rising prices squeezing consumers' purchasing power, and likely to add to pressure from labour groups for higher wage increases.
articles.title: Japan's inflation-adjusted wages slip in September for 18th month

articles.author: Tom Westbrook
articles.description: Asian stocks snapped a three-day winning streak on Tuesday, slipping as the bond market's rally paused and investors reined in enthusiasm about a possible peak in global interest rates.
articles.title: Asia stocks snap winning streak, await RBA

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski, Lisa Richwine
articles.description: The Hollywood actors' union on Monday responded to the latest offer from the major studios and streamers, saying they have yet to reach agreement on several items, including the use of artificial intelligence.
articles.title: Hollywood actors' union notes disagreements with studios' offer, including AI

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel would consider "tactical little pauses" in Gaza fighting to facilitate the entry of aid or the exit of hostages, but again rejected calls for a general ceasefire despite growing international pressure.
articles.title: Israel says it is open to Gaza fighting pauses for aid, hostages

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump complained of unfair treatment in defiant and rambling testimony on the witness stand at his New York civil business-fraud trial on Monday, prompting the judge to threaten to cut his testimony short.
articles.title: Trump defiant at NY fraud trial, judge threatens to cut off testimony

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three people were killed and one injured after a structural collapse at a fitness club in northeast China's Heilongjiang province, county government officials said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Fitness club collapse kills 3 in China's Heilongjiang province
